metadata.title: CVE-2023-37201 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could have triggered a use-after-free condition when creating aWebRTC connection over HTTPS. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 115,Firefox ESR < 102.13, and Thunderbird < 102.13.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-37201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
